Title: Proof of Concept
Changes:
Proof of concept stage to process E-Reports into actionable data.

Functions:
- Process Transmille E Report into json format
- Allow for instant searching between E-status jobs
- Assign jobs live to individual engineers
- Export Engineers 'assigned' lists to excel reports.
- Set active engineers daily
- Settings for colours, engineers, turnaround threshold.

Title: Concept Functionality Complete
Changes:
This update brings many changes, additions and improvements.

Bug Fixes:
- Starting a new day no longer deletes the database file.
- Priorities and Assignments are no longer deleted after a new day start.
- Clicking "Show List" no longer opens a second widget on the screen with two lists. Now operates as "Refresh List".

Changes:
- New day now operates as an import with active engineer selection and a complete backup of the database.
- Print Icon updated to a more appropriate icon.
- Project moved to private Git to avoid file corruption for security.
- Data import handling changed to move 'new data' to a temporary file to allow for comparison between old and new data to obtain analytics data.

Additions/Improvements:
- Bottom options bar now includes "Sub" button, assigning selected jobs to a "Sub" 'engineer' for report exporting. Previously had to scroll down engineer list.
- Import Report button was given proper functionality, allowing database to be updated from a new E-Report (Removing old jobs and adding new ones) without having to reset the entire database.
- Analytics added (Rudimentary and improper, based on the transition from E to any other status based on data provided.
- Show Status now shows telemetry data obtained from updates with tabs for different functions. This is mostly to show what is possible when auto-data-input comes into play, data currently presented should not be trusted as fact (Indication Only).
- Change Log added.
- Improved process for data handling to decrease process speed.
- Added "Current Instruments" counter in bottom corner.
- Added "Active Engineers" to Menu > Edit to allow easier, more dynamic changes to current active staff.


Targets for future:
- More diverse colour coding thresholds to allow for Age Tiers.
- Priority Levels in Urgent Status.
- Easy access to "Live" information showing instruments at different stages. Will operate as an extention to the Current Instruments counter.
- Confirm multi-user support. May require small traffic handler to stop background updates during processes.
- Live updating from files to further support multi-user. Currently users would have to use the "Refresh List" button to re-pull data from dataset.
- Themes. Python has limited ability to modernize GUIs due to tkinter and it's addons being outdated. Working on colour schemes could make it look less... Windows 7.
- Move Sub & Priority exports to their own processes instead of using fake "Engineers" to bypass the issue.

Notes:
Graphs and data visualisations are imported functions from previous projects not intended for this setup. "Show Status" should be considered very proof of concept.

Title: ODIN Package
Changes:
Alpha 2.1.0 brings a rebranding to ODIN, coupled with the "ODIN - Engineer" application.

### ODIN ###
Changes:
- More robust about information and window titles which are now pulled from settings.
- Instead of slow-loading, app now runs immediately and presents a loading screen while data is imported.
- LOGO!!!
- Filetype changed to .pyw to force open as a GUI application. This removes the Windows Commandline needing to be open in the background.

Bug Fixes:
- Show List was duplicating the list on the screen, now operates as refresh again. This was fixed in a previous version but the issue re-presented itself.
- Settings was replaced with an "Instant Change" system. Previous versions had a "Save Changes" button which was removing things outside of it's internal 'template' as the settings file was completely rewritten everytime. Individual values are now changed instead.

### ODIN - Engineer ###
Version: 1.0.0
ODIN - Engineer is an application designed for the individual engineer to use to see their assigned jobs without requiring a printed sheet.

It also allows an engineer to mark jobs as "Complete" quickly and easily. This allows a lab manager to more quickly see progress without the need to 'chase' progress reports. These jobs would be removed from an E-Report import in ODIN as well.

Completed jobs are colour-coded Green so that the engineer can easily see what they have completed.

ODIN - Engineer is made from a more filtered tree function taken from ODIN, meaning they run on the same collaborative system.

### Current Objectives ###
Objective: Create a 'session' system to assign active sessions to each open application on each computer.
Gain: Objectives can send activity reports which can trigger refreshes on other applications, removing the need for manual refreshing while decreasing a 'constant update' system.
Challenges: The current list refresh function destroys the current list and creates a new one. This results in a 'flicker' and selection reset. This could be irritating for the end-user if they are actively working in the application particularly from a management perspective.

Objective: Incorporate N/F/L status imports
Gain: Much more accurate analytics. Easier explanation of current events in morning meetings.
Challenges: Due to the manual nature of Transmille reporting, this adds more work from a management perspective that makes the function more hassle than it may be worth.

Objective: Compiled EXEs, Installer, Auto-Updates
Gain: More user-friendly, quicker/easier install process, no python installation required. Applications can then send a version number request to GitHub to check for updates and alert users to updates and smooth that process.

Objective: Move from tkinter to customtkinter
Gain: This is where the application can start looking like an actual application. Customertkinter allows us to completely change the appearance and make it look more professional and purpose-built.
Challenges: customertkinter presented a problem during testing with menubars, meaning File/Edit/Utilities/About would have to be manually written instead of borrowing from tkinter's prexisting system. Due to python and tkinter forming GUIs on a pack or grid system, it's impossible to "Overlap" properly so you can't build a proper drop-down-from-button system like the pre-existing menubar.

Objective: Themes for light/dark mode
Gain: Makes the current tkinter setup easier on the eyes.
Challenges: Buttons and dropboxes don't like changing colour. More research is required for this.

Side-note, this was an exceptionally fun update to build.
